column4: Hello. It appears that an IBM utility called "Verify Disk" has just wiped our entire system, without warning. "fdisk /dev/sda" and "fdisk /dev/sdb" report zero partitions. Is there any chance they could be wrong, and is there anything we can do find out?
if you have an old copy of the partition table (a log of it from fdisk session) just recreate it same parameters as before.
by the time people get to chanting slogans at the capitalist pigs, reasonable suggests are futile :)
when we get to to 'Microsoft Distribution' of Linux then I'm worried.  ;)
